intro: Cliffortia sarmentosa, commonly known as the silverweed or dwarf silverweed, is a low-growing, mat-forming plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Leguminosae (Fabaceae) and is characterized by its trailing stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pink, often blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and covered in a fine, silvery hair, giving it a distinctive appearance. Cliffortia sarmentosa is adapted to rocky and sandy soils, often found in coastal and mountainous regions.
